review_content:
Delicious, nice colour.
Drank it in the most beautiful beer garden in the world, the Cevercería Patagonia on the Circuito Chico near Bariloche, Patagonia.
Aromat mocno ciasteczkowy, biszkoptowy, lekko tostowy i wlasciwie tyle. Lekkie, niska goryczka, opiekany aftertaste. Nic ciekawego
Amber ale mediana. Aroma e sabor com malte levemente tostado e um pouco de caramelo. Espuma rala e carbonatação média a baixa.

Pouring a radiant copper-brown, this beer glows in the sunlight and supports a fresh, thick, creamy off-white head. The aroma is malty with notes of caramel being quite strong, but the noble hop qualities provide a balance with floral and earthy scents. The malts do an unbelievable job providing this beer with excellent head retention, lacing, a nice full body, along with the active carbonation the mouthfeel really compliments its smooth, crisp taste. The flavour is of creamy toffee-caramel, with a herbal, earthy balance and a slight bit of fruit, peach and apricot being the closest guess. There is a toasty warmth to the finish and a medium hopped bitterness; not too dry and very refreshing. The malt flavour could perhaps be a little stronger to create a more lasting impression.

Read the full review here:

www.beerwithus1.wordpress.com/2019/06/08/patagonia-brewery
A massive bottle in some bar in salta. Fairly decent. Clean and crisp like most ones here. Tastes of something, which is unusual.
Cerveja translúcida com boa carbonatação porém seu sabor não veio junto com a garrafa acho que ficou na Argentina

Nice bright amber, average off-white head and serene crackling. Aroma dominated by malt, caramel and a touch of hop. Taste soft, sweet, rather round, caramel, brioche and a touch of bitterness and acidity. Pleasant, quenching and great with the asados.

Bottle shared at Dutch Brewery Ticking Session with Sjogro and ShivanDragon. Clear light amber color, virtually no head. Smel land taste lightly malts, metallic, slightly sweet and slightly bitter. Oh well. Drinkable.
Donker gouden, witte kraag, koolzuurtje, vrij lucht, dun/waterig van textuur, mout en maisachtige basis, ach bij 30 graden zou het prima smaken
Una Amber della Patagonia da 4,5 gradi. Senza infamia e senza lode, forse troppo amara per la tipologia...
Dutch Brewery Tasting @ Benzai’s. Clear amber with no head. Sweet malts, sickly and weird, dry and bitter, slightly nutty, tea. Moderate sweet and bitter. Light body and soft carbonation.

Brazilian version in SP. Amber color clear big yellowish head, flavors of caramel, sugar and light roasted malt. Some leaves on the hops side, sweetish with a fruity aftertaste. Average to high carbonation, short sugary finish.
Argentina. Pours very clear Amber. Off white head. Scents of malt, caramel and maple syrup. Taste is sugar, syrup, caramel and fruit bread.

Amber lager

Godt at amber er tilføjet, 
Let sødme, honning, 

Livlig, light body, fin sød finish 

Let rødlig, minimum hoved fin flaske der fortæller om det øde grænseområde, hvor humlen er plukket.
Uma cerveja única e com identidade. Uma combinação equilibrada de lúpulo da Patagônia e a mistura de maltes finos é percebida em seu sabor, aroma delicado e cor âmbar.

Delicious, nice colour.
Drank it in the most beautiful beer garden in the world, the Cevercería Patagonia on the Circuito Chico near Bariloche, Patagonia.
Aromat mocno ciasteczkowy, biszkoptowy, lekko tostowy i wlasciwie tyle. Lekkie, niska goryczka, opiekany aftertaste. Nic ciekawego
Amber ale mediana. Aroma e sabor com malte levemente tostado e um pouco de caramelo. Espuma rala e carbonatação média a baixa.

Pouring a radiant copper-brown, this beer glows in the sunlight and supports a fresh, thick, creamy off-white head. The aroma is malty with notes of caramel being quite strong, but the noble hop qualities provide a balance with floral and earthy scents. The…
A massive bottle in some bar in salta. Fairly decent. Clean and crisp like most ones here. Tastes of something, which is unusual.
Cerveja translúcida com boa carbonatação porém seu sabor não veio junto com a garrafa acho que ficou na Argentina

Nice bright amber, average off-white head and serene crackling. Aroma dominated by malt, caramel and a touch of hop. Taste soft, sweet, rather round, caramel, brioche and a touch of bitterness and acidity. Pleasant, quenching and great with the asados.

Bottle shared at Dutch Brewery Ticking Session with Sjogro and ShivanDragon. Clear light amber color, virtually no head. Smel land taste lightly malts, metallic, slightly sweet and slightly bitter. Oh well. Drinkable.
Donker gouden, witte kraag, koolzuurtje, vrij lucht, dun/waterig van textuur, mout en maisachtige basis, ach bij 30 graden zou het prima smaken
Una Amber della Patagonia da 4,5 gradi. Senza infamia e senza lode, forse troppo amara per la tipologia...
Dutch Brewery Tasting @ Benzai’s. Clear amber with no head. Sweet malts, sickly and weird, dry and bitter, slightly nutty, tea. Moderate sweet and bitter. Light body and soft carbonation.

Brazilian version in SP. Amber color clear big yellowish head, flavors of caramel, sugar and light roasted malt. Some leaves on the hops side, sweetish with a fruity aftertaste. Average to high carbonation, short sugary finish.
Argentina. Pours very clear Amber. Off white head. Scents of malt, caramel and maple syrup. Taste is sugar, syrup, caramel and fruit bread.
Amber lager…
Uma cerveja única e com identidade. Uma combinação equilibrada de lúpulo da Patagônia e a mistura de maltes finos é percebida em seu sabor, aroma delicado e cor âmbar.
Amber beer, small head, aroma is malt, fruit, metal, caramel, sweet. Taste is the same, not bad.

Bottle 33cl. @home poured into a lager glass. Clear medium amber, average frothy off-white head, mostly diminishing, light lacing; aroma sweet malt, caramel, wet hay; taste medium sweet and light bitter, malty, caramel, candy sugar, something chemical; abrupt finish; medium body, watery texture, soft carbonation; disappointing, too thin yet drinkable.

6/8/2018. Bottle from Galeria Kaufhof Frankfurt. Pours amber with a lasting slightly foamy off-white head. Aroma s, caramel, malt, fruit and veg. Moderate sweetness with medium bitterness. Moderate body, oily texture, average carbonation.

Decided to go for a fancier country tick than Quilmes. Clear brown. Aroma is caramel hibiscus roasted nuts some sweet molasses. Pistacchio. Somehow off. Also dust and rust. Taste is sweet malt juice with some dust and much oxidized malt. Squeaky and unbalanced. Meh.

Dentro de lo comercial en Argentina, lo más destacable. Aroma a malta, caramelo y algún toque herbal. Sabor predominado por la malta y un amargor moderado y seco. Bien, pero le falta para estar a la altura de las verdaderas Amber.

Small bottle. Pours amber colour. Medium size white head. Aroma of malts, hints of caramel too. Malty, bit caramelly, very slightly fruity taste. Caramelly, bit malty and bitter aftertaste. Rather light bodied medium carbonated brew. Quite well balanced and drinkable lager.

As promised: very clear amber color, medium head. Neutral smell. Light aroma of wood and malt. Also quite neutral. Som sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of malts and vanilla. Taste of malts and some vanilla. Slight bitterness. Beautiful color. Amazing beer.
Cerveja saborosa, suave, com sabor e paladar marcantes. Cor �mbar e espuma bege...

Cerveza de cuerpo medio a ligero con buen aroma y sabor especial suave .. recomendada ..

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear dark amber beer with minimal white head. Aroma is floral, malty, sweet heather. Taste is little metallic, malty, some heather sweetnes. Dry finish. Light body. Quite nice beer actually. Like this little bit different taste of floral or heather.
A true Argentinian Classic. Similar to a Dutch Bock beer. Lovely malty flavour. Smooth character. Light after taste. Very drinkable.
355 ml from Amazon. Malty nose with subtle, sweet carameltones and a slight fruitiness. Cream white head and amber body. Tastes of sweet malts. Decent overall but a bit watery.
355ml bottle. Pours clear amber with a huge most good lasting off-white head. aroma of dry reddish malt, some wood. Taste of reddish malt, very dry, some red fruits, nothing special.

Acobreada, límpida e creme Branco de média formação e persistência média.

Malte com leve caramelo e tostado no aroma, bem suaves com fundo de álcool.

Sabor equilibrado com maltes (caramelo), dulçor presente, floral com um ótimo equilíbrio e final com amargor leve e seco. Corpo médio-leve e muito carbonatada. Boa drinkability. Tem que ser desgustada com temperaturas mais altas (8 a 10oC).

Garrafa de 355ml - Rio de Janeiro, Brasil. Reavaliação Abril/2017

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.33l bottle, gift from work colleague. This one pours a more or less clear looking wood golden colored body in the glass. It as decent looking medium sized off-white head that’s attempting on some dots download the sides of the glass. It doesn’t smell all that bad either. Mild caramel with a little bit of metallic lager. Not a massive aroma but it actually not all that bad. Smells like you’d expect an amber lager to smell. In the mouth it has a mild oily mouthfeel wrapped in a softly carbonated body. Soft corn sweet animals really tastes like your average Argentinan lager this. Don’t be fooled by the amber name. Huge thanks for the bottle Rune! 18.02.2017
Bottle - clear amber color with a creamy head. taste is malty, slightly fruity, caramell. body is watery. tastes cheap and underhopped. sweetish.

355ml bottle. Clear, reddish, dark amber colour with small to average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Weak, sweet-ish malty aroma with a penetrative, peppery spicy touch almost in ammonia direction, fruity overtones with a touch of red berries. Taste is sweet malty fruity, slightly artificial, sugary jelly bear fruitiness, a touch of red berries and cherry, toasty and earthy overtones of bread crust and soil.
Pours hazy amber with a couple of fingers of white head. Aroma of caramel, mild citrus, light bread. Taste is sweet, slightly burnt, slightly roasty. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.

355cm3 bb05/2017. Pours smells and drinks like liquid rust: autumn foliage pour, beige macrobubbles. Damp metallics, wet toast and rust filings in aroma, short of brown champignons and cardboard. A bit like diluted Rotbier in flavour, damp spent chesnut peel bitters and metallics among sweet damp toast. My first lupulos patagonicos...
330ml Flasche. Klar und bernsteinfarben mit minimaler Schaumkrone. Dezente Malznote. Leichter Körper. Mild mit rundem Abgang.

Bottle. Pours medium golden Amber and lightly opaque with a medium white foam subsiding average. Scent is light notes of lightly toasted malt, and light notes of hickory smoke. Taste is fairly plain apple properties of lager. Finish is crisp, dry, and slightly grassy. Very good lager.
Butelka 0,33l Kolor bursztynowy, piana lekko beżowa szybko znika.Lekki zbożowy aromat w smaku słody i trochę traw, wytrawne, winne nuty w aromacie, przeciętne piwo.

Pours a clear amber color, topped with a medium small white head. Slight caramel in the nose, bu thardly. Some soury grassiness. Mildly malty sweet with pleasant gentle bitterness. SHort aftertaste. Sparkly body, light. Decent.

Bottle from gas station in downtown Asuncion. Creamy amber body with medium lasting head. Nose is skunky, eggy, malty. Taste is hops, some caramel, then gets more bitter and hoppier in the finish. Okay.
650ml bottle. This is a poorer one. Very metallic, no real redeeming qualities, liquid metal.
Ótima, doce caramelizada com um teor de mel no fundo, muito indicado pra queijo.

740ml bottle. Pours a clear amber with a small, short lived, off-white head that leaves spotty lacing. Sweet aroma of caramel malt and bread. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, bread, corn and grass with a mildly bitter finish. Light body with a watery texture and soft carbonation. Surprisingly good as far as pale lagers go. Exceeded my expectations.
drunk from the bottle while in Argentinian Patagonia, very solid beer especially compared to the other swill produced in Latin America. Easy to drink, slightly hoppy with a nice sweet finish.
Cerveja de coloração cobre, boa formação de espuma. Agradável aroma de malte, sabor maltado e leve amargor.

18-03-2019; bottle; at home (bought at Saveur Bière, as part of their Oktober 2018 discovery box).
The beer has a nice look. The color of the beer is a beautiful amber, as the name of the beer already strongly suggests. The beer is crystal clear. The bubbles of the beer are very small. The beer pours a decent layer of rough off-white foam. The bulk collapses, but a nice drape of foam remains. The looks are nice.
The smell is quite nice, but a little bit to mild. I can clearly smell some fresh hops. The hops have something citrusy. Malts are simple. A bit bready. A slight yeast aroma is there, slightly meaty, but not in a disturbing way. Also some spicy notes are there. Not that special.
The taste of the beer is fine. There is a pilsener bitterness. There is a slight alcohol flavour. The result is a bit bittersweet. There is also a clear sweet and slightly sour hop flavor in the beer. It is a bit floral and more lively than plain pilsener. Not bad.
The palate of the beer is fine. Medium body, smooth texture and medium-low carbonation. The finish of the beer isn't super special. Short, some bready malts and slight bitter hops, with a fruity note. All in all, not to bad. But, not the most special beer on earth.

I bought this beer in Lima, Miraflores. To be honest, I was expecting something better. The color is pleasant to see, it is copper, thin foam, disappearing quickly. The taste is watery, no hop and no malt, sad taste, nothing special.

Ambar con destellos naranjas, espuma baja sin retención. Malta maltoso caramelo tostado moderado, lúpulo herbal bajo, notas tostadas, ligera oxidación, melanoidinas. En boca malta maltoso caramelo bajo, lúpulo herbal bajo, lúpulo de amargor bajo. Final fresco maltoso sin astringencia, cuerpo bajo, carbonatación media.
Cerveja leve com bom custo beneficio. Cor &acirc;mbar, aroma agrad&aacute;vel e refrescante.

740ml bottle my wife brought back from Argentina 

Pours clear dark golden with a medium sized off-white head, some lacing. Aroma of sweet malts, cereal and caramel. Taste is sweet grains, caramel and grassy 

Decent, a little sweet though.
Cerveja muito boa, fraca, boa para refrescar, tem uma cor bem marcante, cerveja casual.
Uma cerveja diferente e boa, mas não é imperdível. Quase não amarga e, diferente da Coruja, isso não faz dela uma cerveja melhor.

Bottle. 
Pours amber. 
Aroma of fudge. 
Drinkable and sweet vienna like, low bitterness.

Bottle.
Amber white head
Aroma of orange, caramel, rich aroma
Taste ok, sweet orange, some beer can taste. Quite rich flavours 
Fizzy.
Pours clear amber with thin white head. Light malty aroma. Taste is slight sweet malt, no hops at all. Light body, easy drinking. Very weak amber lager, but tastier than regular macros.
Schöne hellbraune Farbe, Geruch leicht röstig süß schwacher Hopfen, Geschmack leider etwas flach röstaromen leichte bitternote
Aus der Flasche. Bernsteinfarben, wenig Schaum. Röstmalzaroma mit leichter Säure und Hopfen in der Nase. Röstig im Geschmack, etwas flach und zu viel Kohlensäure.
Bottle, shared with Rockley. Medium sienna hue, average white head. Grainy with bready caramel, light, with a boxboard note in the finish. Not as bad as I feared it would be.

Small Lacey white head. Colour is a light orange red and clear. Aroma of sugar with a slight hint of grass. Taste of grass, caramel/sugar with an overall sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

740ml brown bottle. Colour is deep golden, very clear. Soapy white head on top. Aroma is sweet, caramel, some dusty grains. Taste has sweet grains, notes of caramel and weak grassy hops. A touch nutty at the end with low bitterness. Fairly unexciting, but not bad.
Aroma is light sweet malts, sulphur and that’s about it. Taste is light roasted malts and caramel. Pretty bland overall. Gold clear body .
Bottle in BA. Nose is really nice with notes of leafy noble hops and caramel. Flavor follow suit - really a nice lager with a hoppy finish. Great stuff.
Buena cerveza. No es mi estilo preferido pero queda bien con las comidas. La contra como todas las patagonias es el precio
Âmbar com média formação de espuma. Leves toques de caramelo, malte tostado, um pouco de madeira e discreto lúpulo. Corpo leve com agradável picancia, final médio, adocicado e pouco amargor

Cerveja límpida,translúcida,coloração âmbar acobreada,espuma cremosa bem formada e com boa duração,aroma se desprendeu bem,apresentando malte tostado,caramelo,frutas secas e vermelhas;sabor maltado levemente frutado e com suave amargor no final dando um bom equilíbrio,corpo baixo/médio,boa carbonatação e drinkability. Amber leve,desce fácil,um pouco aguada,mas gostei.
Una cerveza buena, de rico sabor, suave como todas las comerciales pero recomendable para comidas amenas
Drank it in Bariloche, good taste, not to bitter, it went perfect after a long walking day!
Poured from a bottle at Gonzalez Beer Bar in Buenos Aires. Light red color with tiny ring of white head. Light malty and carmel taste. A typical amber lager. Easy drinker
Good beer- Good taste for the dayaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
No es la mejor versión de amber Lager, podría mejorar bastante Patagonia acá, es preferible otra si querés tomarte una
Cor âmbar com boa espuma, aroma acentuado de caramelo, amargor bem leve e suave.

Ótima cerveja! Cor caramelo, sabor muio bem equilibrado entre amargor e adocicado.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 750ml in BA restaurant.
Amber color, small steady off-white head. Light malty notes but also some vegetables. Light-bodied to medium-bodied. Light maltyness, some caramel and grassy hops. Low-key beer which should drink fresh on tap.

Consorella invidiata e riverita della linea Quillmes. Gustosa, amara e rinfrescante. Sfortunatamente i camerieri argentini (4 su 4) la servono in un secchio di acqua ghiacciata come lo spumante, ma basta aspettare qualche minuto per gustarne tutte le sfumature.

Bottle 740ml.

Clear medium yellow amber colour with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, hay, caramel, sweet malt. Flavour is moderate sweet with a long duration, sweet malt, caramel. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130601]

Best amber I ever had. Amazing taste. Very refreshing , nice color amber 740ml

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tried this after visiting the new Quilmes DC in Mercado Central, where they distribute all the InBev brands (including *locally* produced Stella Artois and all Pepsi products). Best beer from Quilmes, caramel aroma but not overwhelming sweetness, excellent appearance with a nice dark copper color, watery, but full bodied compared to other Argentinan beers. Refreshing. Some hop flavor but no hop aroma. Best beer available in Bs Aires, for what it’s worth.
É una larger com sabor maus intensos... E de cor marcante... Lúpulo é da patagonia...kkkkkkk

740ml Bottle:  Aroma of malt, grain, corn, mash, and a hint of caramel.  Poured amber in color with a small, white head that diminished but lasted throughout as a film on top of the beer, as well as around the edges.  Slightly cloudy.  Sparkling.  Some medium-sized particles throughout.  Flavor is slightly sweet.  Tastes of malt, mash, and corn.  Medium body.  Average texture.  Average carbonation.  Malt, corn, mash finish is lightly sweet.
Sampled in El Calafate. A decent brew. About what I came to expect from all beers down there. Good taste though, but not too much bite.
the best commercial beer from Quilmes, it has a nice appearance, a little bit watery, but refreshing. Drank it while eating fondue, it was very fine; have to try it again.
I swear Quilmes just put a different label on their Red variety and jacked up the price a little - if this is an amber, it’s fairly trashy.  For a lager, its passable.

De color ambar claro con aroma a maltas caramelo y levadura, un sabor suavemente dulce y amargo, ligera y de final amargo.

Features: 
AROMA Malt: caramel, bread, cereal, floral, Yeast: dough, licorice, 
COLOR: amber, hazy
TASTE: light sweetness, lightly bitter, 
PALATE: light body, thin feel, Finish: bitter

Poured from a large bottle I purchased while living in Argentina into a small wine-type glass to drink.  The beer had a pretty clear, medium-dark, amber-gold color with a small creamy off-white head that had short retention and modest cling.  The beer had a muted aroma of caramel malt, barley, and some grainy hops, but nothing stood out too well.  Its taste was somewhat sweet and malty with a caramel presence, and a slight complimentary bitter-grain effect too.  The body had light to average carbonation with a thinner, watery feel, and a somewhat dry effect.  Overall a satisfactory beer, but not highly successful.
